HomeBanner.subtitle: Harmonization & Analysis of Sequencing & Phenotype Data

tab1.title: Speed Up Diagnosis
tab1.description: Prioritises genetic mutations in patients based on their phenotypes described using the Human Phenotype Ontology.

tab2.title: Multiple Analysis Tools
tab2.description: Exomiser, PubmedScore, Phenogenon, SimReg, Bevimed and SKAT score genetic variants and phenotypes.

tab3.title: Gene-Phenotype Relations
tab3.description: Using the gene or phenotype view, understand the spectrum of phenotypes that gene mutations lead to.

statistic.title: Phenopolis Statistics
statistic.description: Phenopolis includes data from {{ exomes }} exomes representing a total number of {{ variants }} variants.

contact.description: Please feel free to contact us <1>here</1> to give us feedback or report any issues.

Footer.Description: Phenopolis is a platform for harmonization and analysis of sequencing and phenotype data. Development of Phenopolis was initially supported by RP Fighting Blindness, NIHR (UCL-Moorfields Eyes Hospital Biomedical Research Center), the UK Medical Research Council, the British Heart Foundation and the Japan Society for the Promotion of Science.
Footer.Citation: If you use Phenopolis, please cite us as: <1>Pontikos, N. et al. (2017). Phenopolis: an open platform for harmonization and analysis of genetic and phenotypic data. Bioinformatics, 9, 7</1>

About.Title: About Us
About.Mission_Content: Phenopolis is an open-source web server providing an intuitive interface to genetic and phenotypic databases. It integrates analysis tools such as variant filtering and gene prioritization based on phenotype. The Phenopolis platform will accelerate clinical diagnosis, gene discovery and encourage wider adoption of the Human Phenotype Ontology in the study of rare genetic diseases.

Product.Title: Purchase Analysis Service
Product.Exome_Analysis_Content: We help you to conduct whole exome analysis, and organize data into phenopolis for all your lab members or colaborators. Our service contains:
Product.Exome_Analysis_Description: <0>Mutation Detection.</0> <1>Integrating between Phenotypes, mutation genes.</1> <2>Deployment of Phenopolis system.</2> <3> Long lasting service in 3 years. </3>

Individual.Rare_HOMs_subtitle: This is the list of rare homozygous variants in this individual obtained with thresholds.
Individual.Rare_Comp_Hets_subtitle: This is the list of rare compound heterozgote variants (more than one variant in a given gene) found in this individual obtained with allele frequency thresholds.
Individual.Rare_Variants_subtitle: This is the list of rare heterozgote variants found in this individual obtained with allele frequency thresholds.

Gene.Variants Analysis_subtitle: Here are a list of variants found within this gene.

HPO.Individuals_subtitle: Below is a list of individuals who have this phenotype or a descendant of it.
HPO.Literature_Genes_subtitle: Below is a list of the literature genes from OMIM which are associated with this phenotype.
HPO.Phenogenon_subtitle: Below is a list of the significant Phenogenon genes.
HPO.SKAT_subtitle: Below is a list of genes and their variants from the Sequence Kernel Association Test (SKAT).
HPO.RECESSIVE_subtitle: <0>Genotype</0> : With at least two variants on a given gene that have ExAC homozygous count not higher than <2>2</2> and CADD phred score not lower than <4>15</4>.
HPO.DOMINANT_subtitle: <0>Genotype</0> : With at least one variant on a given gene that has an ExAC heterozygous count not higher than <2>0.0001</2>, and CADD phred score not lower than <4>15</4>.

Variant.Frequency_subtitle: Frequency of the variant in external databases and internally.
Variant.Consequences_subtitle: Consequence of the variant on transcripts.
Variant.Quality_subtitle: Quality of the variant on transcripts.
